Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet (heart)
Description: Amulet in the likeness of a heart.  One of the surfaces is flat while the other is slightly rounded. The heart ends with a 5 mm protuberance, through which the suspension hole has been pierced. This object, together with many other elements, was part of a necklace which was found in Tomb 209: fifteen beads, one amulet (L 2145 (a)) and a cowry shaped bead bearing hieroglyphs meaning Menkheperre (Thutmosis III) (L 2146).
